sen.j: 七福神（しちふくじん）とは、福をもたらすとして日本で信仰されている七柱の神である。
sen.e: Shichifukujin refers to seven deities which are believed to bring good luck in Japan.
Shichifukujin refers to seven deities which are believed to bring good luck in Japan.
Shichifukujin refers to seven deities which are believed to bring good luck in Japan.

sen.j: 個々の神
sen.e: Each deity
Each deity
Each deity

sen.j: 一般には以下の七柱の神とされる。
sen.e: They are generally supposed to be the seven deities mentioned below.
They are generally supposed to be the seven deities mentioned below.
They are generally supposed to be the seven deities mentioned below.

sen.j: えびす
sen.e: Ebisu
Ebisu
Ebisu

sen.j: 古くは「大漁追福」の漁業の神であった。
sen.e: It used to be the deity of fishery for 'good catch and happiness' in ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外対処「追福」は確かに辞書では死者の冥福を祈ることとなっているますが、ここでは幸福の追求ほどの意味だと思い、用語集のmemorial serviceでなく、happinessにしました。下の方でも「追福祈願」というのがあり、同様に訳出。
sen.e: It used to be the deity of fishery for 'good catch and happiness' in ancient times.
It used to be the deity of fishery for 'good catch and happiness' in ancient times.

sen.j: 時代と共に福の神として「商売繁盛」や「五穀豊穣」をもたらす、商業や農業の神となった。
sen.e: With the times, it has become the deity of commerce and agriculture bringing 'prosperous trade' and 'the productiveness of grain' as a deity of good luck.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外対処
sen.e: With the times, it has become the deity of commerce and agriculture bringing 'prosperous trade' and 'good harvests' as a deity of good luck.
With the times, it has become the deity of commerce and agriculture bringing 'prosperous trade' and 'good harvests' as a deity of good luck.

sen.j: 大黒天
sen.e: Daikokuten
Daikokuten
Daikokuten

sen.j: インドのヒンドゥー教のシヴァ神と日本古来の大国主命の習合。
sen.e: It is syncretization of Shiva from Hinduism in India and Okuninushi no Mikoto from ancient Japan.
It is syncretization of Shiva from Hinduism in India and Okuninushi no Mikoto from ancient Japan.
It is syncretization of Shiva from Hinduism in India and Okuninushi no Mikoto from ancient Japan.

sen.j: 大黒柱と現されるように食物・財福を司る神となった。
sen.e: As in the expression Daikoku bashira (the central pillar or the mainstay), it has become the deity controlling food and fortune.
As in the expression Daikoku bashira (the central pillar or the mainstay), it has become the deity controlling food and fortune.
As in the expression Daikoku bashira (the central pillar or the mainstay), it has become the deity controlling food and fortune.

sen.j: 毘沙門天
sen.e: Bishamonten
Bishamonten
Bishamonten

sen.j: 元はインドのヒンドゥー教のクヴェーラ神で、これが仏教の神のヴァイシュラヴァナ（多聞天）になり日本では毘沙門天と呼ばれる。
sen.e: It was originally Kubera from Hinduism in India, which has become Vaishuravana (Tamonten) as a Buddhism deity and is called Bishamonten in Japan.
It was originally Kubera from Hinduism in India, which has become Vaishuravana (Tamonten) as a Buddhism deity and is called Bishamonten in Japan.
It was originally Kubera from Hinduism in India, which has become Vaishuravana (Tamonten) as a Buddhism deity and is called Bishamonten in Japan.

sen.j: 弁才天 （弁財天）
sen.e: Benzaiten
Benzaiten
Benzaiten

sen.j: 七福神の中の紅一点で元はインドのヒンドゥー教の女神であるサラスヴァティー神。
sen.e: It is an only female among Shichifukujin, and was originally Saraswati, a female deity from Hinduism in India.
It is the only female among Shichifukujin, and was originally Saraswati, a female deity from Hinduism in India.
It is the only female among Shichifukujin, and was originally Saraswati, a female deity from Hinduism in India.

sen.j: 七福神の一柱としては「弁財天」と表記されることが多い。
sen.e: As a deity of Shichifukujin, it is mostly written as '弁財天.'
As a deity of Shichifukujin, it is mostly written as '弁財天.'
As a deity of Shichifukujin, it is mostly written as '弁財天.'

sen.j: 福禄寿
sen.e: Fukurokuju
Fukurokuju
Fukurokuju

sen.j: 道教の宋 (南朝)の道士または、道教の神で南極星の化身の老子である寿老人の別名または同一神とされる。
sen.e: It is supposed to be a Taoist of Taoism in Song (Southern Dynasty), or another name or the same deity of Jurojin, which is Lao-tzu, a deity of Taoism and incarnation of the southern polar stars.
It is supposed to be a Taoist of Taoism in Song (Southern Dynasty), or another name or the same deity of Jurojin, which is Lao-tzu, a deity of Taoism and the incarnation of the southern polar stars.
It is supposed to be a Taoist of Taoism in Song (Southern Dynasty), or another name or the same deity of Jurojin, which is Lao-tzu, a deity of Taoism and the incarnation of the southern polar stars.

sen.j: 寿老人
sen.e: Jurojin
Jurojin
Jurojin

sen.j: 道教の神で南極星の化身の老子。
sen.e: It is Lao-tzu, a deity of Taoism and incarnation of the southern polar stars.
It is Lao-tzu, a deity of Taoism and the incarnation of the southern polar stars.
It is Lao-tzu, a deity of Taoism and the incarnation of the southern polar stars.

sen.j: 布袋
sen.e: Hotei
Hotei
Hotei

sen.j: 唐の末期の明州に実在したといわれる仏教の僧。
sen.e: It is a Buddhism monk who is said to have existed in Ming Zhou at the end of Tang Dynasty.
It is a Buddhism monk who is said to have existed in Mingzhou at the end of Tang Dynasty.
It is a Buddhism monk who is said to have existed in Mingzhou at the end of Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 一般におめでたい存在、縁起物とされる。
sen.e: They are supposed to be auspicious existence and lucky charm.
They are supposed to be auspicious existence and lucky charms.
They are supposed to be auspicious existence and lucky charms.

sen.j: 正月に枕の下に、「七福神の乗った宝船の絵」を入れておくと、良い初夢が見られると言われる。
sen.e: It is said that putting 'a picture of Shichifukujin on Takarabune (treasure ship)' under the pillow in the New Year makes you have a good Hatsuyume (the first dream in the New Year)).
It is said that putting 'a picture of Shichifukujin on Takarabune (treasure ship)' under the pillow in the New Year makes you have a good Hatsuyume (the first dream of the year)).
sen.cmt: in the New Year→of the year
sen.e: It is said that putting 'a picture of Shichifukujin on Takarabune (treasure ship)' under the pillow in the New Year makes you have a good Hatsuyume (the first dream of the year)).

sen.j: 七柱それぞれの社（やしろ）を順に回り、縁起を呼ぶお参りがある。
sen.e: There is a way to visit shrines to get good luck by going to each of seven shrines in order.
There is a way to visit shrines to get good luck by going to each of seven shrines in order.
There is a way to visit shrines to get good luck by going to each of seven shrines in order.

sen.j: これを七福神めぐりと言う。
sen.e: This is called Shichifukujin meguri (visiting Shichifukujin).
This is called Shichifukujin meguri (visiting Shichifukujin).
This is called Shichifukujin meguri (visiting Shichifukujin).

sen.j: 由来
sen.e: Origin
Origin
Origin

sen.j: インドのヒンドゥー教（大黒・毘沙門・弁才）、中国の仏教（布袋）、道教（福禄寿・寿老人）、日本の土着信仰（恵比寿・大国主）が入り混じって形成された、神仏習合からなる、いかにも日本的な信仰対象である。
sen.e: It is a typical Japanese object to believe in, which is syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism, with Hinduism in India (Daikoku, Bishamon and Benzai), Chinese Buddhism (Hotei) and Taoism (Fukurokuju and Jurojin), and indigenous belief (Ebisu and Okuninushi) in Japan mixed.

It is a typical Japanese object to believe in, which is syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism, with Hinduism in India (Daikoku, Bishamon and Benzai), Chinese Buddhism (Hotei) and Taoism (Fukurokuju and Jurojin), and indigenous belief in Japan (Ebisu and Okuninushi) mixed.
sen.cmt: in Japan を in India と同じく括弧の前にしました。
sen.e: It is a typical Japanese object to believe in, which is syncretism of Shinto and Buddhism, with Hinduism in India (Daikoku, Bishamon and Benzai), Chinese Buddhism (Hotei) and Taoism (Fukurokuju and Jurojin), and indigenous belief in Japan (Ebisu and Okuninushi) mixed.

sen.j: 室町時代末期頃から信仰されていると言われている。
sen.e: It is said that it has been believed in since around the end of the Muromachi Period.
It is said that it has been believed in since around the end of the Muromachi Period.
It is said that it has been believed in since around the end of the Muromachi Period.

sen.j: 但し、寿老人と福禄寿はともにカノープスの化身とされることから、この二者は本来同一のものとみなし、寿老人の代わりに吉祥天や猩猩が入れられたことがあった。
sen.e: However, since both Jurojin and Fukurokuju are supposed to be incarnation of Canopus, they were regarded to be originally same, and Kisshoten or Shojo was included once instead of Jurojin.
However, since both Jurojin and Fukurokuju are supposed to be the incarnation of Canopus, they were regarded to be originally the same, and Kisshoten or Shojo was included once instead of Jurojin.
However, since both Jurojin and Fukurokuju are supposed to be the incarnation of Canopus, they were regarded to be originally the same, and Kisshoten or Shojo was included once instead of Jurojin.

sen.j: これは関西から始まったもの。
sen.e: This started in Kansai.
This started in Kansai.
This started in Kansai.

sen.j: 誰がいつこの顔ぶれに、と定めたのかは不明。
sen.e: It is unclear who decided these members and when.
It is unclear who decided these members and when.
It is unclear who decided these members and when.

sen.j: 時代によってこの顔ぶれに異同がある。
sen.e: The members differ according to times.
The members differ according to times.
The members differ according to times.

sen.j: 猩猩、稲荷神が外れたのは、人間の姿ではなかったためとも言われている。
sen.e: It is also said that Shojo and Inari-shin were excluded because they didn't have a human figure.
It is also said that Shojo and Inari-shin were excluded because they didn't have a human figure.
It is also said that Shojo and Inari-shin were excluded because they didn't have a human figure.

sen.j: 中国では、七福神と似た八仙（八福神）と呼ばれるものがあり、全てが実在の人物（仙人）であったといわれ、各地でその姿を描いた絵が信仰の対象になっている。
sen.e: In China, there exist Hassen (eight deities of good luck) similar to Shichifukujin, each of which is said to have been an actual person (hermit), and the picture of them is an object to believe in across the nation.

In China, there exist Hassen (eight deities of good luck) similar to Shichifukujin, each of which is said to have been an actual person (hermit), and the picture of them is an object to believe in across the nation.

In China, there exist Hassen (eight deities of good luck) similar to Shichifukujin, each of which is said to have been an actual person (hermit), and the picture of them is an object to believe in across the nation.

sen.j: その絵は日本の七福神ににているので、この八仙が元になったとする説がある。
sen.e: Since the picture looks like Japanese Shichifukujin, there is an theory that this Hassen is the origin of it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外対処
sen.e: Since the picture looks like Japanese Shichifukujin, there is an theory that this Hassen is the origin of it.
Since the picture looks like Japanese Shichifukujin, there is an theory that this Hassen is the origin of it.

sen.j: が、七福神は三人から徐々に増えたという説から否定的見解もある。
sen.e: However, there is a negative opinion against it, according to the theory that Shichifukujin has gradually increased from three.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外対処
sen.e: However, there is a negative opinion against it, according to the theory that Shichifukujin has gradually increased from three.
